state.public_key: Corresponding public key burned to firmware

outputs.provenance: sorted list of contributing philosopher SKG IDs

ring_topology.description: Each core Ci receives signed verdicts from C(i-1) and C(i+1)
ring_topology.verification: Verify EdDSA signatures using firmware public keys

fallback.action: Escalate to human review with full artifact set

isolated_dissent.condition: Exactly one core produces different verdict_hash
isolated_dissent.tolerance: System continues if consensus exists among remaining 2/3

split_failure.condition: Verdict hashes split 2-2 (even number of cores)

entropy_divergence.condition: entropy(Ci) differs by >2σ from group mean
entropy_divergence.response: Flag for investigation but do not automatically reject
entropy_divergence.rationale: High entropy may indicate legitimate uncertainty, not fault

build_phase.1_generate_keys: Each core generates ChaCha20-Poly1305 + Ed25519 keypair
build_phase.2_burn_public_key: Public key written to firmware ROM, marked read-only
build_phase.3_encrypt_core: Core logic encrypted with private key
build_phase.4_destroy_private_key: Secure erase, no copies, no backups

initialization.firmware_verification: Bootloader verifies public key integrity against hash
initialization.self_test: Core runs internal diagnostic, outputs signed test_verdict
initialization.consensus_ring_activation: Cores exchange signed test_verdicts to verify protocol

runtime.key_absence_verification: Periodic hardware check that private key memory is zeroed
runtime.tamper_detection: Any attempt to read private key region triggers hardware fuse
